alert.note: Alert for Harris; Liberty; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 5:33PM CST until January 08 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Harris, Liberty and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen so far today. Ongoing locally heavy rain with rates up to 2.5 inches per hour will quickly runoff and produce minor flooding of streets and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Humble, Cleveland, Kingwood, Splendora, Patton Village, Roman Forest, Woodbranch, Plum Grove, Lake Houston, northern Atascocita, Tarkington Prairie, New Caney, Porter and Rye. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
